tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from Cube to Schenker, dated January 16, 1932

tei:transcription.tei:p: Hamburg, Beneckestr. 2; bei Alexander Schmidt. 16. I. 32.

Anbei die gewünschte Notiz! A review of Das Meisterwerk in der Musik, by Ludwig Rottenberg, mentioned by Cube in a lost letter of December 1931, and requested by Schenker in vC 41, January 14, 1932. See Schenker’s reply, vC 42, January 20, 1932. Mit der Bitte um Rücksendung lege ich einen Brief bei, der die Haltung des Musikredakteurs beleuchtet. This letter was probably written by Otto Vrieslander: in his next letter Schenker thanks Cube for showing him “the Uncle’s” letter, “Uncle” or “Uncle Otto” referring always to Vrieslander. Dzialas is presumably the editor of a journal or newspaper in which Cube is hoping to publish an article; Vrieslander’s letter supplies a report of Dzialas’s character. Mein geplanter Artikel kann erst im Frühjahr erscheinen. Dafür sagte Dzialas mir seinerzeit, dass Herr Dr. Karl Holl Karl Holl was a music critic for the Frankfurter Zeitung in the 1910s and 20s. Many of his pieces were kept in Schenker’s collection of newspaper clippings (OC 2). inzwischen Ihre Bücher besprechen würde. Dies ist nun geschehen. –

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from Cube to Schenker, dated January 16, 1932

tei:translation.tei:p: Hamburg, Beneckestrasse 2, c/o Alexander Schmidt January 16, 1932

Enclosed is the notice you asked for. I am enclosing a letter, which will shed light on the music editor’s attitude; please return it to me. My planned article cannot appear until early spring. By way of compensation, Dzialas for his part told me that Dr Karl Holl would, in the meantime, review your books. This has now been done.
With my most cordial greetings, Yours, [signed:] Cube
